mechanoreception.notes: Echinoids possess mechanoreceptors for sensing touch and substrate vibrations. This is inferred from related echinoderms and the general lifestyle of burrowing sea urchins.

chemoreception.notes: Echinoids use chemoreception to detect food and other chemical cues in the environment. This is a common sensory modality in echinoderms.

photoreception.notes: The presence or absence of photoreception in Echinolampadidae is currently unknown.
